overview: From 2026-01-31 to 2026-02-01, elizaos-plugins/registry had 1 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 3 active contributors.

topPRs.title: Add Agent Index plugin for x402 endpoint discovery
topPRs.author: CIII-glitch
topPRs.body:
## Plugin Details **Package:** `agentindex-eliza-plugin` **Repository:** https://github.com/CIII-glitch/agentindex-eliza-plugin **NPM:** https://www.npmjs.com/package/agentindex-eliza-plugin ## Description Agent Index plugin enables Eliza agents to discover x402 endpoints - the payment-enabled APIs in the x402 ecosystem. ### Actions - `SEARCH_AGENT_INDEX` - Search for x402 endpoints by keyword, category, or price - `TRENDING_ENDPOINTS` - Get trending x402 endpoints ### Installation ```bash npm install agentindex-eliza-plugin ``` ### Usage ```typescript import { agentIndexPlugin } from 'agentindex-eliza-plugin'; // Add to your Eliza agent plugins: [agentIndexPlugin] ``` ## Links - Website: https://theagentindex.app - API Docs: https://api.theagentindex.app/docs.html - x402 Protocol: https://x402.org ## Summary by CodeRabbit ## Chores * Added a new plugin source to the available registry, expanding the integration ecosystem. ✏️ Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

This PR adds the `agentindex-eliza-plugin` to the elizaOS plugin registry. The plugin enables Eliza agents to discover x402 payment-enabled API endpoints. **Key Changes:** - Added registry entry mapping `agentindex-eliza-plugin` to `github:CIII-glitch/agentindex-eliza-plugin` - Plugin provides actions for searching x402 endpoints and viewing trending endpoints **Issues Found:** - **Alphabetical ordering violation**: The entry is placed at the top of the file but should appear after all `@`-scoped packages (between `@tonyflam/plugin-openchat` and `plugin-connections` at line 215-216). The README explicitly requires alphabetical sorting of entries.

Confidence Score: 2/5

- Not safe to merge due to alphabetical ordering requirement violation - The change itself is simple and follows the correct format for registry entries. However, it violates the explicit alphabetical sorting requirement documented in the README (line 23). This will cause inconsistency in the registry and may affect automated processing or searching. The entry must be moved to the correct alphabetical position before merging. - index.json requires the entry to be moved to the correct alphabetical position (after line 215)

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | index.json | Added `agentindex-eliza-plugin` entry but violates alphabetical ordering requirement |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Dev as Plugin Developer participant PR as Pull Request participant GHA as GitHub Actions participant Reg as Registry (index.json) participant Gen as generated-registry.json participant CLI as elizaOS CLI Dev->>PR: Add plugin entry to index.json PR->>GHA: Trigger on merge to main GHA->>Reg: Read index.json GHA->>GHA: Fetch plugin metadata from GitHub GHA->>GHA: Gather version info from Git tags GHA->>GHA: Check NPM package metadata GHA->>Gen: Generate and commit updated registry CLI->>Gen: Fetch plugin registry data CLI->>CLI: Display available plugins Dev->>CLI: Install plugin via elizaOS CLI CLI->>GitHub: Clone plugin repository CLI->>CLI: Load plugin dynamically ``` (2/5) Greptile learns from your feedback when you react with thumbs up/down!
